monogr.title: biology and genetics, in particular how habitat and fragmentation influence population structure and regulation in freshwater fish. The major interests of Knut H. Røed are in the use of molecular markers for understanding patterns and processes of population divergence and social organization, and their significance to conservation. Per Erik Jorde is a population geneticist working on temporal genetic change and spatial genetic structure in various organisms. Åge Brabrand focuses his research on fish communities
